topic: This house believes in the use of affirmative action

premise: Two studies compare countries internationally before and after implementing social welfare programs. The results of both studies show that poverty has been significantly reduced during the periods where major welfare programs were created

topic: This house believes that opinion polls harm the democratic process

premise: A study by Albert Mehrabian, reported in The Journal of Applied Social Psychology (1998), tested the relative importance of the bandwagon (rally around the winner) effect versus the underdog (empathic support for those trailing) effect. Bogus poll results presented to voters prior to the 1996 Republican primary clearly showed the bandwagon effect to predominate on balance. Indeed, approximately 6% of the variance in the vote was explained in terms of the bogus polls, showing that poll results (whether accurate or inaccurate) can significantly influence election results in closely contested elections.
